intro: Oreopanax thaumasiophyllus, commonly known as the golden leaf oreopanax, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its striking, palmate leaves that are often a vibrant yellow or golden green. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in umbels, which are followed by red, fleshy berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its unique appearance and rarity, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
